sections.title: Polynucleotide treatments to support skin quality
sections.body: Injectable polynucleotides used in staged courses to encourage skin regeneration and elasticity, offered only after clinical assessment.
bullets: Consultation-led suitability checks and informed consent
Protocols tailored to delicate areas such as under-eye skin when appropriate
Course plans with measured intervals and follow-up

sections.title: Evidence-informed protocols with escalation pathways
items: Medical-grade polynucleotide products sourced through regulated supply
Aseptic preparation and superficial placement to protect vessels and nerves
Course design that avoids overlapping treatments when the skin needs recovery
Clear instructions on when to contact us urgently for unusual swelling or discomfort

sections.title: Careful assessment before regenerative injectables
sections.body: We review your medical history, medications, and skin health to confirm suitability. If appropriate, we outline how polynucleotides differ from skin boosters (/treatments/skin-boosters) or fillers (/treatments/dermal-fillers) and plan a course targeting areas that benefit from tissue support, such as periorbital or mid-face skin.
bullets: Contraindication screening and discussion of realistic expectations
Photography and mapping to monitor changes over the course
Clear spacing between sessions (often 2–4 weeks) to allow healing
Written aftercare and escalation guidance before the first session

sections.title: For patients suited to regenerative injectable care
items: Those seeking improved skin elasticity or quality where volume is not the goal
Patients with delicate under-eye or peri-oral skin needing cautious support
People prepared for a staged course with reviews rather than a single-session change
Not suitable where infection, uncontrolled medical issues, or pregnancy are present

sections.title: Plan, deliver, review
items: Consultation: suitability checks, photography, and treatment planning
Course delivery: microinjections placed at agreed intervals using fine needles
Review: assessments to track skin response and comfort after each session
Maintenance: optional top-ups scheduled once initial course benefits are stable
sections.strapline: Response varies by skin quality and lifestyle. We adapt spacing or pause treatment if your skin needs more time to settle.

sections.title: Superficial delivery for gentle stimulation
sections.body: Polynucleotides are placed in superficial planes with fine needles to spread evenly and minimise bulk. Depth, spacing, and product amount are recorded so future sessions can be adjusted accurately.
sections.mediaHint: Polynucleotide microinjections planned across under-eye and mid-face

sections.title: Supportive aftercare with clear escalation steps
items: Pinpoint redness or swelling is expected for 24–72 hours; bruising can occur
Avoid strenuous activity, heat, and active skincare until advised
Contact us promptly if you notice increasing pain, unusual colour change, or signs of infection
Follow-up visits confirm healing before any further sessions

faqs.question: How do polynucleotides work?
faqs.answer: They are injectable biopolymers designed to support skin regeneration and hydration. We use regulated products and place them in superficial planes for gentle stimulation.

faqs.question: When will I notice changes?
faqs.answer: Skin often feels more supple within weeks, with further improvements over a staged course. We review progress after each session.

faqs.question: Can I combine polynucleotides with other treatments?
faqs.answer: Often yes, when sequenced carefully. We may pair them with anti-wrinkle care (/treatments/anti-wrinkle-treatments) or skin boosters (/treatments/skin-boosters) in separate appointments if clinically appropriate.

faqs.question: Are polynucleotides suitable for everyone?
faqs.answer: No. We avoid treatment if you are pregnant, breastfeeding, unwell, or have skin infections. Suitability is confirmed during consultation.

faqs.question: What if I do not like the outcome?
faqs.answer: Effects are gradual and course-based. We review after each session and can pause further treatment if expectations are not aligned.
